intro: Ilex sapotifolia, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ilex sapotifolia typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests and rocky slopes. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural use in suitable climates.
